data.title: Wendy McEwan on LinkedIn: #respectandcare #mentalhealth #pgru
data.meta_description: Mental Health Matters. Grateful to Helen Hari Disha and the entire leadership team at PropertyGuru Group for their genuine investment in mental healthâ€¦
data.text:
On this World Mental Health Day, we want to share an insightful interview excerpt with Mrs. Radhika Gupta, CEO of Edelweiss Asset Management Limited, from our veteran series. In this interview, she discusses how to cope with life's rejections and emphasizes the significance of openly addressing mental health issues while building a support system. Link - https://lnkd.in/dxAJidw7 We also encourage you to watch her talk titled 'The Girl with a Broken Neck,' which offers valuable insights for personal growth and resilience - https://lnkd.in/dcQDUDdc As she draws from her own life experiences, her words resonate deeply and leave a lasting impact. Let's use this World Mental Health Day to challenge the stigma surrounding discussions about both money and mental health. Recognize that they are integral components of our overall well-being. Strive for equilibrium, seek support, and prioritize your mental health. A well-defined financial plan can provide peace of mind, alleviating anxiety and contributing to better mental health. Take a step towards nurturing both aspects of your life today. #FinancialWellness #MentalHealthMatters #WMHD Ladder7 Wealth Planners Westland Books

Today, on #RUOKDay, we take a moment to reflect on the well-being of our incredible team here at Dulili Solutions. In the hustle and bustle of our daily lives, it's easy to forget the importance of checking in on each other's mental health. ğŸ’¬ "Are you okay?" - It's a simple yet powerful question that can make all the difference in someone's life. At Dulili, we want to emphasise that we're not just colleagues, but a family that cares deeply for one another. ğŸ§  Mental health is just as crucial as physical health. It's okay to not be okay sometimes, and it's perfectly normal to face challenges. What matters is that we're here for each other, ready to lend an empathetic ear, offer support, or simply share a friendly conversation. ğŸ¤ Remember, seeking help is a sign of strength, not weakness. ğŸŒˆ We encourage each team member to take time for self-care, to recharge, and to reach out to colleagues if needed. ğŸ’¡ Together, we can break the stigma surrounding mental health and create a workplace where everyone feels valued, heard, and supported. ğŸŒŸ Thank you to our exceptional Dulili family for all that you do. You are our greatest asset, and your well-being is our top priority. #MentalHealthMatters #WellnessAtWork #Teamwork #RUOK #WeAreHereForYou Remeber to connect, reach out, and support each other, not only on #RUOKDay but every day. Together, we can make a positive impact on mental health awareness and well-being at Dulili.

Social Media Post for Upcoming Blog ğŸŒŸ Next Week on BatShit Blog: "Understanding Mental Health: What It Is and Why It Matters" ğŸŒŸ Are you ready to dive into the fascinating world of mental health? ğŸ§ âœ¨ Join us next week as we unravel the mysteries behind what mental health truly is and why it's crucial for everyone! ğŸ¤¯ From the science of the mind to real-world applications and personal stories, we've got it all covered. Whether you're a mental health newbie or a seasoned wellness warrior, this blog post is packed with insights, laughs, and a few cheeky anecdotes that'll leave you wanting more. ğŸ”¹ Topics We'll Cover: The nuts and bolts of mental health ğŸ› ï¸ Why mental health is just as important as physical health ğŸ’ª Practical tips for boosting your mental wellbeing ğŸŒ¿ Real-life stories to inspire and motivate ğŸŒˆ ğŸ’¬ Stay Tuned and Get Ready to Unleash Your Inner Mind Ninja! ğŸ’¬ ğŸ‘‰ Donâ€™t miss out! Hit that follow button and join the BatShit community for a rollercoaster ride through the mind, where understanding mental health is both enlightening and entertaining. #MentalHealthMatters #Wellbeing #BatShitBlog #MentalHealthAwareness #StayTuned #ComingSoon ğŸ”¥ Catch the full blog next week on BatShit Blog! ğŸ”¥

Through Self-Respect Kawalâ€™s Transformative Journey Kawal, a young woman, felt constantly overwhelmed and unappreciated due to her inability to set boundaries. Realizing her lack of self-respect was the root of her problems, she embarked on a journey to change. Self-respect, a key part of self-esteem, has a significant impact on our mental health and overall well-being. Here are some important statistics: - Mental Health: High self-esteem lowers anxiety and depression. - Life Satisfaction: It leads to greater life satisfaction, resilience, and happiness. - Performance: Low self-esteem affects work performance and health negatively. -Relationships: High self-respect helps set healthy boundaries By aligning her actions with her values, practicing self-compassion, and setting boundaries, Kawal improved her mental health, productivity, and relationships. Her journey shows that cultivating self-respect can transform oneâ€™s life, leading to greater happiness and fulfillment. How does self-respect shape your experiences? #self-respect #MentalHealth

SOOOO excited getting ever closer to announcing the first ever HeartACT Wilderness Experience: a unique combination of Wilderness Healing and Forest Bathing! Let me take you on a journey of Healthy Mental Health with this Wilderness Experience that allows you to express yourself in a way that supports you and gives you tools to control your out-of-control emotions. Because our time together is limited, I cannot bring you everything that I have to offer in the full Wilderness and Forest Bathing experiences but know that what I take you through will give you a better understanding of yourself and a better understanding of me, what I do, and how I can support you with healthier mental health, even in this short time together. What you will gain: ğŸŒ³ An insight and get a taste of how some of this experience's tools can help you take the necessary steps to dissolve your repeating negative life patterns, ğŸŒ³ Regain control of your controlling emotions, ğŸŒ³ Ease the brain fog, a symptom of your stress and anxiety. ğŸŒ³ Be inspired and empowered to build and strengthen your emotional resilience to be equipped to live your best life. However, that looks for you. ğŸŒ³ Regain the balance in your life and live it with more peace, joy, and happiness. Click on the link to be one of the first to get access to the first ever HeartACT Wilderness Experience: https://lnkd.in/eVsewQPz #heartact #mentalhealth #debbiedebonaire

ğŸ“ŠHalf of Polish employees experience symptoms of depression, and 16% of them are at serious risk of it (source: Mindgram Polska) This means that in our immediate environment there are people who experience feelings of sadness, depression or hopelessness. However, these are not the only symptoms, because this disease has many faces. What symptoms may indicate depression? ğŸ”Loss of self-confidence and self-esteem, feeling of uselessness and excessive and unjustified guilt. ğŸ”Negative view of the future and pessimistic thinking. ğŸ”Decreased ability to concentrate, pay attention and remember. ğŸ”Loss of interest and pleasure in everyday activities. ğŸ”Deterioration of sleep quality - it often becomes very short and does not allow for rest. ğŸ”Loss of appetite, which may lead to weight loss. If you have been suffering from low mood for a long time, you no longer enjoy things that you used to enjoy, or you notice any of the above symptoms, consult a specialist or share your feelings with your loved ones. Remember that you are not alone. Depression is not a weakness, it is a disease that requires support. It's important that we start talking openly about depression and other mental health issues. Together we can counteract it and create a more empathetic and supportive environment. Let's take care of our mental health as much as we do our physical health. #MentalHealthWeek #LoveYourselfFirst #selfcare #WarsawDBSHub

Mental Health Awareness Month is upon usâ€¦ What is Mental Health? Mental health includes our emotional, psychological, and social well-being. It affects how we think, feel, and act, and helps determine how we handle stress, relate to others, and make choices. Mental health is important at every stage of life, from childhood and adolescence through adulthood. Over the course of your life, if you experience mental health problems, your thinking, mood, and behavior could be affected. https://www.samhsa.gov â€º mental-health/ Here are just a few tips to taking care of your mental health...Practice Mindfulness, Staying Active, Getting Enough Sleep, Practicing Gratitude and Seeking Support When Needed... Plus if you've ever been in an auto accident Injury Care Clinic has 3 tips on overcoming your fear of driving afterwards...scan or click here: https://lnkd.in/gmdSJ8bJ ğŸ’¥ğŸš¨If you've been involved in an auto accident call the INJURY CARE EXPERTS today for same or next day appointments: 321-952-9993. Se habla EspaÃ±ola. Injury Care Clinic team specializes in AUTO INJURY TREATMENT... So you can focus in what's most important... YOU AND YOUR RECOVERY...Injury Care Clinic offers PATIENT-CENTRIC CARE #mentalhealthmatters #mentalhealthawareness #drslattery #roadtrips #medicaldoctor #chiropractic #physicaltherapist #physicaltherapistassistant #rehabilitationspecialist #nowhiring #autoinjury #14days #moretraffic #autocrash #carcrashwhiplash #whiplashrecovery #safedriving #backpain #kneepain #spacecoast #spacecoastliving #brevardcounty

**Mental Health Awareness Week** 13th - 19th May 2024 - Have you got these dates in your calendars for next week? Did you know the theme for Mental Health Awareness Week this year is "Movement - Moving More For Our Mental Health"? Movement is so important but so many of us struggle to move enough. We have listed below a few ways movement and physical activity can help our mental healthâ€¦ - Managing stress - Improves mood - Reduces anxiety and depression - Increases fitness levels Keep an out for CEB next week as we'll be announcing how employee benefits can help your employees and the workplace for Mental Health Awareness Week. ğŸ’š #MentalHealthAwarenessWeek #Movement #EmployeeBenefits #CEB
